density.note: Liquid methane (LNG) is less dense than water; floats on water

specificHeat.note: High specific heat for a cryogenic liquid

latentHeatOfVaporization.note: Energy to vaporize liquid methane at -161.5°C

evaporationCoefficient.note: Hertz-Knudsen α coefficient. High value - nonpolar, weak van der Waals forces only. Range 0.01-1.0.

latentHeatOfFusion.note: Energy to melt frozen methane at -182.5°C

antoineCoefficients.TminC_note: EMPIRICALLY VERIFIED RANGE MINIMUM: The Antoine coefficients were experimentally validated down to this temperature. Calculations below this are extrapolated (smooth curve continues, but accuracy may degrade).
antoineCoefficients.TmaxC_note: EMPIRICALLY VERIFIED RANGE MAXIMUM: The Antoine coefficients were experimentally validated up to this temperature. Calculations above this are extrapolated (smooth curve continues, but accuracy may degrade).
antoineCoefficients.source: Methane vapor pressure from liquefied natural gas (LNG) thermodynamic handbooks; valid for cryogenic liquid range.
antoineCoefficients.note: Methane only exists as liquid below -161.5°C at 1 atm. Critical for LNG vapor pressure modeling at extreme cold temperatures.

flammability.note: Liquid methane (LNG) vaporizes rapidly when spilled; resulting vapor is extremely flammable
